items.title: Track Competition

items.description: Sport Trucks typically feature a wide, low profile and offer drivers responsive handling and strong traction on paved roads.

items.title: Racing
items.description: Strong traction and performance on the drag strip, or race, street, or dirt track

items.title: Winter
items.description: For snow, ice, and freezing temperatures

header.subtitle: Consistently rated as excellent by 255-40r17 drivers
Most popular among drivers in PA
Check out the sale price on this tire
Consistently rated as excellent by 255-40r17 drivers

content.body:
### Shop 255/40R17 Tire Size
255/40R17 tires are commonly found on sports and performance cars from the 90s to early 2010s. If you drive or had an Acura NSX, BMW Z4, Honda S2000, Mercedes-Benz E350, or Porsche 911 from that timeframe, then there’s a chance your ride takes 255/40R17 tires. These vehicles are often paired with performance-oriented tires to help bring out their sporty traction and handling, and a brand new version of any of them might’ve rolled out of the factory with a set of Bridgestone Potenza RE040, Bridgestone Potenza RE050A RFT/MOE/II, Bridgestone Potenza RE070, or [Pirelli P Zero Rosso Asimmetrico](https://simpletire.com/brands/pirelli-tires/p-zero-ross-asimmetrico) tires attached.

Popular vehicles include:
2002-2005 Acura NSX
2007-2013 BMW Z4
2008-2009 Honda S2000
2010-2013 Mercedes-Benz E350
1989-2005 Porsche 911

Drivers of sports and performance cars need a set of tires that can push the envelope, but what about a set that can be used year-round? Ultra-high-performance all-season tires are the best of both worlds for drivers of sports and performance cars, and tires like the Michelin Pilot Sport All Season 4, Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 PLUS, Toyo Proxes Sport A/S, and [Yokohama Advan Sport A/S Plus](https://simpletire.com/brands/yokohama-tires/advan-sport-a-s-plus) are engineered to be driven at higher speeds while also offering excellent traction and braking capabilities in dry, wet, and light winter weather conditions.

Maybe you’re ok with using multiple sets of tires per year, and want something that can be used when temperatures are consistently above 45 degrees Fahrenheit. Ultra-high-performance tires are ideal for these conditions, so take a look at the Firestone Firehawk Indy 500,[Kumho Ecsta V730](https://simpletire.com/brands/kumho-tires/ecsta-v730), Nitto NT555 G2, and GT Radial CHampiro HPY if you need a tire that’s built to perform at a high level in warmer weather.

Whether you drive a BMW Z4, Mercedes-Benz E350, Porsche 911, or something else, SimpleTire has a set of 255/40R17 tires that meets your needs at a great price!

info.title: Did you know?
info.body: A reliable brand is the #1 ask for most drivers. Here you can shop all the most popular brands and discover new ones – all tested, ranked and rated by our customers.
